Module org.nasdanika.html.jstree
Package org.nasdanika.html.jstree.impl

Class DefaultJsTreeFactory

java.lang.Object
org.nasdanika.html.jstree.impl.DefaultJsTreeFactory
All Implemented Interfaces:
JsTreeFactory
public class DefaultJsTreeFactory extends Object implements JsTreeFactory
HTML factory which relies on Bootstrap styles and scripts.
Author:
Pavel

    • buildAjaxJsTree

      public String buildAjaxJsTree(String nodesUrl, String contextMenuUrl)
      Description copied from interface: JsTreeFactory
      Builds JsTree object for loading nodes and context menus using AJAX from the specified URL's. Node id is passed to the server side in "id" request parameter.
      Specified by:
      buildAjaxJsTree in interface JsTreeFactory
      Parameters:
      nodesUrl - URL to load nodes.
      contextMenuUrl - URL to load context menus. Can be null.
      Returns:
      String representation because JSON does not support functions.

    • bind

      public Tag bind(String selector, Object jsTree, Object filter, Object searchInputSelector)
      Description copied from interface: JsTreeFactory
      Generates script tag for binding jsTree to html element.
      Specified by:
      bind in interface JsTreeFactory
      filter - Filter script to manipulate jsTree object before passing it to jsTree. It can be used to add functions to jsTree, which are not supported by JSON. The filter script can access jsTree via tree variable.
      searchInputSelector - If not null, binds input to tree search.
      Returns:

    • bind

      public Tag bind(HTMLElement<?> htmlElement, Object jsTree, Object filter, Object searchInputSelector)
      Description copied from interface: JsTreeFactory
      Generates script tag for binding jsTree to html element.
      Specified by:
      bind in interface JsTreeFactory
      filter - Filter script to manipulate jsTree object before passing it to jsTree. It can be used to add functions to jsTree, which are not supported by JSON. The filter script can access jsTree via tree variable.
      searchInputSelector - If not null, binds input to tree search.
      Returns:
